concept.title: Formatting Numbers
concept.shortdesc: How to quickly format numbers with predefined styles.

conbody.p: Numbers can be displayed in different ways, with or without decimal places, with a currency symbol, with various separators in a date or time format , etc. And if the predefined formatting options are not enough, you define your own format.
When entering some numbers, Excel puts them in the correct format automatically.

ul.li: If you enter in a cell 19% then Excel will recognize the percent symbol and displayed the number right aligned as 19%. The content of the cell will be 0.19 and not 19.
If you enter in a cell €123,45 then Excel recognizes it as a currency. The content of the cell will be 123,45 and this content will be displayed right aligned as € 123,45.

If you enter in a cell 1/2 Then Excel thinks that it is a date and displayed it as 2-Jan.Excel stores dates and times as serial numbers starting with 1 January 1900 as number 1. Number 2 is then 2 January 1900, etc. And if you enter 1/2 in a cell, then the current year will automatically added, for example 1/2/2013 and then the real content of the cell will be 41276.

conbody.p:
To quickly assign a format to a number, use of the command buttons in the Number group (tab Home). Group Number on the ribbon
Group Number on the ribbont
In the middle you find command buttons for some frequently used formatting styles:

dlentry.dd: Accounting style. The down arrow gives some currency symbols.

conbody.p:
At the top you can see the actual formatting of the selected cell. For example General and beside a down arrow for a choice list with predefined styles. In the figure you can see this list for a cell with content 0.19. And in this list you can choose another format. List with styles for formatting numbers
List with styles for formatting numbers
When the desired formatting is not in the list then you can click on More Number Formats.... The dialog box Format Cells appears with the tab Number selected. Here you can define your own format.
